title: 37k-Mile 1995 Porsche 911 Carrera Coupe 6-Speed
description: This 1995 Porsche 911 Carrera coupe was purchased by the seller in 2023 and has since been driven 2k of the 37k miles shown. The car is powered by a 3.6-liter flat-six paired with a six-speed manual transaxle and is finished in Polar Silver over gray leather upholstery. Additional equipment includes 18" wheels, a power-operated sunroof, headlight washers, rear stone guards, a speed-activated rear spoiler, a “basket handle” fixed rear spoiler, cruise control, a Porsche Classic Radio, and air conditioning. This 993 Carrera coupe is now offered with the owner's manual, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 37k-Mile 1995 Porsche 911 Carrera Coupe 6-Speed at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #173,348.
text: This 1995 Porsche 911 Carrera coupe was purchased by the seller in 2023 and has since been driven 2k of the 37k miles shown. The car is powered by a 3.6-liter flat-six paired with a six-speed manual transaxle and is finished in Polar Silver over gray leather upholstery. Additional equipment includes 18″ wheels, a power-operated sunroof, headlight washers, rear stone guards, a speed-activated rear spoiler, a “basket handle” fixed rear spoiler, cruise control, a Porsche Classic Radio, and air conditioning. This 993 Carrera coupe is now offered with the owner’s manual, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title. The car is finished in Polar Silver (L92M) and features headlight washers, fog lights, power-adjustable mirrors, a power-operated sunroof, rear stone guards, a speed-activated rear spoiler, a “basket handle” fixed rear spoiler with an integrated third brake light, a rear window wiper, and dual exhaust outlets. The rear spoiler plate was replaced in March 2023. The 18″ wheels are mounted with 225/40 front and 265/35 rear Michelin Pilot Sport 4S tires that were installed in March 2023. Braking is handled by Porsche-branded calipers over cross-drilled rotors at all four corners. The rear brake pads were also replaced in March 2023. The front seats are upholstered in gray leather and complemented by a color-coordinated center console, door panels, and carpeting. A Porsche Classic Radio was installed in March 2023, and additional amenities include cruise control, Porsche crest floormats, and air conditioning that was also recharged in March 2023. The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames VDO instrumentation including a central tachometer with a 6,800-rpm redline, a 180-mph speedometer, an analog clock, and gauges for oil pressure, oil temperature, oil level, and fuel level. The six-digit odometer shows 37k miles, approximately 2k of which were added under current ownership. The air-cooled 3.6L flat-six was factory rated at 270 horsepower and 243 lb-ft of torque. In March 2023 an oil change was performed and the air filter and oil level sender were replaced in March 2023. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transaxle. Decoding the option sticker reveals the following information: L92M – Polar Silver paint C02 – Version for USA 030 – Sports suspension 220 – Limited-slip differential 224 – Automatic Braking Differential (ABD) 233 – Internal production code related to tires 331 – Becker Porsche CR-1 cassette stereo 398 – 17″ wheels 454 – Cruise control 650 – Power sunroof The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage. There is currently a lien out on the car, and the seller’s lender will need to be paid off before the title can be transferred to the new owner. Head over to our friends at Car and Driver to check out their June 1994 Road Test for the 911 Carrera. Filed under: 993 You are not connected to real-time updates. Attempting to connect. html:
This 1995 Porsche 911 Carrera coupe was purchased by the seller in 2023 and has since been driven 2k of the 37k miles shown. The car is powered by a 3.6-liter flat-six paired with a six-speed manual transaxle and is finished in Polar Silver over gray leather upholstery. Additional equipment includes 18″ wheels, a power-operated sunroof, headlight washers, rear stone guards, a speed-activated rear spoiler, a “basket handle” fixed rear spoiler, cruise control, a Porsche Classic Radio, and air conditioning. This 993 Carrera coupe is now offered with the owner’s manual, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title.

The car is finished in Polar Silver (L92M) and features headlight washers, fog lights, power-adjustable mirrors, a power-operated sunroof, rear stone guards, a speed-activated rear spoiler, a “basket handle” fixed rear spoiler with an integrated third brake light, a rear window wiper, and dual exhaust outlets. The rear spoiler plate was replaced in March 2023.

The 18″ wheels are mounted with 225/40 front and 265/35 rear Michelin Pilot Sport 4S tires that were installed in March 2023. Braking is handled by Porsche-branded calipers over cross-drilled rotors at all four corners. The rear brake pads were also replaced in March 2023.

The front seats are upholstered in gray leather and complemented by a color-coordinated center console, door panels, and carpeting. A Porsche Classic Radio was installed in March 2023, and additional amenities include cruise control, Porsche crest floormats, and air conditioning that was also recharged in March 2023.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames VDO instrumentation including a central tachometer with a 6,800-rpm redline, a 180-mph speedometer, an analog clock, and gauges for oil pressure, oil temperature, oil level, and fuel level. The six-digit odometer shows 37k miles, approximately 2k of which were added under current ownership.

The air-cooled 3.6L flat-six was factory rated at 270 horsepower and 243 lb-ft of torque. In March 2023 an oil change was performed and the air filter and oil level sender were replaced in March 2023.

Power is sent to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transaxle.

Decoding the option sticker reveals the following information:

  • L92M – Polar Silver paint
  • C02 – Version for USA
  • 030 – Sports suspension
  • 220 – Limited-slip differential
  • 224 – Automatic Braking Differential (ABD)
  • 233 – Internal production code related to tires
  • 331 – Becker Porsche CR-1 cassette stereo
  • 398 – 17″ wheels
  • 454 – Cruise control
  • 650 – Power sunroof

The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

There is currently a lien out on the car, and the seller’s lender will need to be paid off before the title can be transferred to the new owner.

Head over to our friends at Car and Driver to check out their June 1994 Road Test for the 911 Carrera.

Filed under: 993
